com.att.research.xacml.api

Interface Status

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JaxpStatus, StdMutableStatus, StdStatus

    public interface Status
    Defines the API for objects that represent XACML Status elements.
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.1 $
    Author:
    Christopher A. Rath

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      Implementations of the Status interface must override the equals method with the following semantics: Two Status objects (s1 and s2) are equal if: s1.getStatusCode().equals(s2.getStatusCode()) AND s1.getStatusMessage() == null && s2.getStatusMessage() == null OR s1.getStatusMessage().equals(s2.getStatusMessage()) s1.getStatusDetail() == null && s2.getStatusDetail() == null OR s1.getStatusDetail().equals(s2.getStatusDetail())
      StatusCode getStatusCode()
      Gets the StatusCode for this Status.
      StatusDetail getStatusDetail()
      Gets the StatusDetail associated with this Status if there is any.
      java.lang.String getStatusMessage()
      Gets the String status message for this Status.
      boolean isOk()
      Returns true if the StatusCode for this Status is the XACML OK value.
      Status merge(Status status)
      Returns a Status with the same StatusCode and status message as this Status but whose StatusDetail is the merging of the StatusDetail in this Status and the StatusDetail in the given Status.

    • Method Detail

      • getStatusCode

        StatusCode getStatusCode()
        Gets the StatusCode for this Status.
        Returns:
        the StatusCode for this Status.

      • getStatusMessage

        java.lang.String getStatusMessage()
        Gets the String status message for this Status.
        Returns:
        the String status message for this Status

      • getStatusDetail

        StatusDetail getStatusDetail()
        Gets the StatusDetail associated with this Status if there is any.
        Returns:
        the StatusDetail for this Status if there is any.

      • isOk

        boolean isOk()
        Returns true if the StatusCode for this Status is the XACML OK value.
        Returns:
        true if the StatusCode for this Status is the XACML OK value, else false

      • merge

        Status merge(Status status)
        Returns a Status with the same StatusCode and status message as this Status but whose StatusDetail is the merging of the StatusDetail in this Status and the StatusDetail in the given Status.
        Parameters:
        status - the Status whose StatusDetail is to be merged in
        Returns:
        a Status with merged StatusDetail

      • equals

        boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Implementations of the Status interface must override the equals method with the following semantics: Two Status objects (s1 and s2) are equal if: s1.getStatusCode().equals(s2.getStatusCode()) AND s1.getStatusMessage() == null && s2.getStatusMessage() == null OR s1.getStatusMessage().equals(s2.getStatusMessage()) s1.getStatusDetail() == null && s2.getStatusDetail() == null OR s1.getStatusDetail().equals(s2.getStatusDetail())
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
